page.title: 08EDUCATION
page.content:
Education
Withernwick County Primary school was first built in 1846 and then added to in 1862.These two dates can be seen on one of the school walls.The school was first called the National School. The school has two classrooms and had 45 children on roll in the Summer Term,1985.The school is for children from 5 years to 11 years of age. In 1965 there were only 13 children at the school but more houses were built and so more children came to live in the village and the school was able to continue. When the pupils are 11 years old they travel on the local bus to the comprehensive school in Hornsea. The children from New Elerby & Marton travel to Sproatley P. School & South Holderness School.
